data.title: Gorgeous
data.text: I was Baptized here, as was by Father & siblings. Until I went out of my hometown, I did not know how truly beautiful it is. When he was only 18, my Uncle did a replacement fresco on the ceiling, when someone stepped through the ceiling.

data.title: Beautiful historic church with a welcoming feel
data.text: Went to mass while in town to visit our daughter. Felt very welcomed and comfortable. The music was pretty and added to the reverence of the mass.

data.title: about to celebrate its 125th year.
data.text: Murals and stations of the cross by Bro Joseph Carrignano who was also the gardner and cook.  Not great art but remarkable that one man did it all.  For those going to Mass, the choir under Gina Lapke is one of the best in the west.

data.title: Beautiful Church
data.text: We made the trip to Missoula to watch St. Francis University play the University of Montana in football last week, so when we saw St. Francis Xavier Church, we had to stop in and say a few prayers for the Red Flash.  The Church was beautiful and the stained glass windows are remarkable.  It's a small church, so it only takes a few minutes to tour and appreciate the frescoes on the ceiling and behind the alter.

data.title: Pretty Catholic Church
data.text: Historic old church with nice stained glass windows.  15 minutes and you can see it all.  Fairly typical of other churches in Helena, Boise, etc.

data.title: Beautiful church, welcoming congregation
data.text: We were traveling through Missoula and wanted to attend mass before heading out.  This was the closest parish to our hotel so we attended 8 am mass.  What a wonderful surprise.  Extremely welcoming.  My 14 y.o. daughter could not stop looking at the frescos and stained glass windows throughout mass.  So glad we found you!

data.title: Family Tradition
data.text: We are a Catholic family and we have made it a priority to visit or attend a Catholic Church or mass while on a vacation.  We were thoroughly impressed from the time we entered to the time we left. Worth your while to visit even if just for a minute!

data.title: Returning to my Roots.
data.text: I was in Missoula visiting family and took my husband to the church I attended as a child.  It was an incredible experience!  What I took for granted as a child brought tears to my eyes as an adult. The murals and stained glass windows are simply awesome.  Although I'm no longer a practicing Catholic, the return to this church brought back a flood of emotions and many many fond memories.

data.title: Beautiful interior if you're in the area.
data.text: It looks like any other church from the outside, but the artwork on the inside is amazing.  There were people there praying so I was not comfortable photographing or walking around.

data.title: What a Wonderful Cathedral
data.text: We are not Catholics, however always stop at Cathedrals when open to see the wonderful statues and paintings, especially if the Church is older. Took many wonderful photographs and we were lucky an organ player was playing. It made our travel day more enjoyable.

data.title: Whenever you need to pray, this church is open
data.text: The inside is a sight to behold-it is beautiful. It is really nice that someone is here all day for those of us who like to pray other than mass times.

data.title: A special place
data.text: We are parishioners here.  The walls and ceilings are covered with murals of Biblical scenes.  We can always tell who attends here regularly and who does not by the way they enter.  Visitors walk down the main aisle while looking upward.  One should keep in mind its historical value; it is over 100 years old.

data.title: Overhyped, unfortunately
data.text: After reading the reviews of this church, I made a point of visiting it to see its artwork.  I typically love churches and cathedrals.  So I hate to be critical, but honestly, it doesn't live up to its hype.  It is a nice church, don't get me wrong, but it's not exactly one of the wonders of the universe.  :)  The faux painted marble everywhere was... unfortunate.  We met the priest, who seemed nice, and I certainly have nothing against the church or its congregants.  But as attractions in Missoula go, St. Xavier is nowhere near the top ten.

data.title: Wow! What a church this is!
data.text: This church over 100 years old is magnificent.  Stop by and take a look. .easy to find in downtown Missoula

data.title: Friendly parish & welcoming priest
data.text: We attended 10am mass on Sunday and we were very impressed how welcoming and friendly people were.  We were visiting for the weekend.  The inside painting was beautiful and fairly European style.

data.title: Lived it
data.text: Cool place to visit. Loved the paintings and the stained glass. They were recarpetting while we were there but they let us come in and see things anyway.

data.title: A visit to a historical church
data.text: I had read about this 100 year old church in my AAA Guide with its 90' spire and amazing beautiful paintings.  There is an approximate 15 minute video that can be viewed that tells of the history of the church and how the many murals, statues and paintings were restored in a little over a year's time by one novice monk in 1901-1902 time period.  There was a gentleman working in the gardens the day we visited who was able to answer questions in addition to the video viewed and flyers available.  This small church is located in the downtown area and is a must see.  I highly recommend a visit to this beautiful historical church.

data.title: Gorgeous, historical church!
data.text: This is a truly wonderful and exciting place!  Built by the black robes when monks came to a wilderness to bring religion to an already spiritual people, it is even more exciting when you realize that most of the artwork was done by a young novice monk with no art training, a mere postulant!  The holiness of the natural surroundings are compounded by the glorious natural surroundings!

data.title: Beautiful!
data.text: This cathedral is so beautiful. It's a smaller cathedral but worth checking out. It's in the downtown area near so many other attractions, easy to get to.

data.title: 100 yr old Church
data.text: We were surprised to find the church open on a Sunday afternoon. Walked inside and it is amazingly beautiful.  Its a small church but the paintings and the front altar are gorgeous.  Sat for a few minutes in a pew and looked around at the décor.  It appears to be as it was when it was just built.  Worth the time to go in and take a look.
